channel.title: How do I make a client so it runs cache from c drive? (fixed)
channel.description:
Says above is there a tut for this? there prolly is... give me link or something or tell me? thank you
also how to make the cache download to the c drive

item.title: How do I make a client so it runs cache from c drive? (fixed)
item.dc:creator: @belhelmiel belhelmiel
item.description:
@belhelmiel wrote:

[quote=“g0 bk t0 lum, post:10, topic:401968”][quote author=belhelmiel link=topic=499021.msg3650867#msg3650867 date=1309724675]
I recommend not doing that people can’t delete it all at once if theres a bad error or the cache gets permanently messed up. That is one of the flaws of a webclient actually. I would keep it in the client. You can right click on the folder and click properties and set it to a hidden folder so they cant steal any files or stuff from it. A lot of coders either jar the files so its all one javascript file that you open to play. or they hide every file and folder except the play and compile buttons. Good luck :3 Another way is you can put all the files in one folder and make another folder to put that folder in and play shortcuts in.
[/quote] what has that got to do with this thread ? wrong thread much ?[/quote]
It was just advice I went off topic a bit so that he knew the other possibilities of ways to hide cache in case he/she wanted the cache hidden

Read full topic
item.source: How do I make a client so it runs cache from c drive? (fixed)

[quote=“belhelmiel, post:9, topic:401968”]I recommend not doing that people can’t delete it all at once if theres a bad error or the cache gets permanently messed up. That is one of the flaws of a webclient actually. I would keep it in the client. You can right click on the folder and click properties and set it to a hidden folder so they cant steal any files or stuff from it. A lot of coders either jar the files so its all one javascript file that you open to play. or they hide every file and folder except the play and compile buttons. Good luck :3 Another way is you can put all the files in one folder and make another folder to put that folder in and play shortcuts in.[/quote] what has that got to do with this thread ? wrong thread much ?

item.source: How do I make a client so it runs cache from c drive? (fixed)

item.title: How do I make a client so it runs cache from c drive? (fixed)
item.dc:creator: @belhelmiel belhelmiel
item.description:
@belhelmiel wrote:

I recommend not doing that people can’t delete it all at once if theres a bad error or the cache gets permanently messed up. That is one of the flaws of a webclient actually. I would keep it in the client. You can right click on the folder and click properties and set it to a hidden folder so they cant steal any files or stuff from it. A lot of coders either jar the files so its all one javascript file that you open to play. or they hide every file and folder except the play and compile buttons. Good luck :3 Another way is you can put all the files in one folder and make another folder to put that folder in and play shortcuts in.

Read full topic

item.source: How do I make a client so it runs cache from c drive? (fixed)

item.title: How do I make a client so it runs cache from c drive? (fixed)
item.dc:creator: @g0_bk_t0_lum g0 bk t0 lum
item.description:
@g0_bk_t0_lum wrote:

open up signlink.java
search for
public static String findcachedir() {
underneath you should see

String as[] = {""};
change to this
String as[] = {“C:/”};
also underneath that you should see
String s = “”;
change that to
String s = “yourcachename”;

then search for
public static String sencondDir() {
underneath that you should see
File file = new File("");
change it to
File file = new File(“C:/yourcachename/”);

obviously change the yourcachename to the names of your cache and that should work fine

Read full topic
